comment.author: 31950372@N05
comment._content: The ads for Moxie, birch beer and peanuts suggest that it was photographed in the USA, in spite of the tricolors on various automobiles.

comment.author: 38714066@N00
comment._content: This is NYC.  The bus in the background is going to Washington Square.  Seems to be 5th Ave at 82nd St.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sethgaines] Correct. On the TIFF image, you can read the street names. View in 2011: Street View. Some of the houses, hidden now by trees, are still there.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
48094458@N00
comment._content: The first car is a Rolls Royce, the 2d a Renault, the 4th a Ford.   I knew Moxie went national, but I thought birch beer was a New England thing.

comment.author: 10799299@N00
comment._content: Those tricolor flags would be suffrage flags which were gold, white and purple.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks so much for your research B-59. This photo indeed matches the other image in the photostream titled: Auto Parade to Welcome Mrs. Field. Don't know why the caption didn't carry over to this one.  But we will add it as well as the new information about the event the next time we update.
